summary: The Parental Rights Over The Education and Care of Their Kids Act (PROTECT Kids Act) mandates that public elementary and middle schools receiving funds under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 obtain parental consent before altering a minor student's gender markers, pronouns, or preferred name on school forms, or changing sex-based accommodations. This applies to locker rooms and bathrooms. The bill defines “covered student” as a minor in elementary or middle school and references specific definitions from the Elementary and Secondary Education Act.
